new reg_check: :smile: :flag-us: :robot_face: Thank for signing up. We’ll send you :bell: and :information_source:  about dates and candidates. We don’t support parties or candidates, just so you know. The first step for voting is finding out if you’re registered. Are you registered? [:+1: :-1: :confused:]
reg_check reg_check_n: :poop: :frowning: You should check out the http://elections.bexar.org/Registration/Register/register.html to find out how to register to vote! Do you need help to register?
reg_check reg_check_?: :confused: You should check out http://apps.bexar.org/ElectionSearch/ElectionSearch.aspx?psearchtab=1 to find out if you’re registered. Be sure to click the ‘voter registration check’ tab.
early: Early voting starts in a few weeks. Get informed about what’s on your ballot (link), including local elections. Do you want :information_source: on all the candidates?  [:+1: :-1: :confused:]
early_n: :poop: Alright. If you change your mind, though, here’s http://www.vote411.org/
early_?: There are 3 ways to vote: 1. :mailbox_with_mail:, 2. early voting, and 3. in person on :calendar: November 8th. Do you want more information on one of these? You can type back 1, 2 or 3.
early_?_1: OK. To receive a ballot to vote by mail you have to submit an application. You can go to https://webservices.sos.state.tx.us/vrrequest/bbm.asp to request an application be mailed directly to you. Then you can you fill it out and mail, scan or fax it back.
early_?_2: We are skipping option 2 for simplicity.
early_?_3:
OK. To vote, you must bring ID. Your ID can be a: 

Texas Driver License
Texas Election Identification Certificate (EIC) (end of first text)
Texas Personal Identification Card issued by DPS
Texas license to carry a handgun issued by DPS (end of second text)
US military identification card containing the person's photograph
US citizenship certificate containing the person's photograph
US passport (end of third text)

Do you have one of these? (user can text “Yes”, “No” or :confused: or something similar)
early_?_3_y: You can find your voting location here: https://teamrv-mvp.sos.texas.gov/MVP/mvp.do. Here’s a link to your ballot: http://www.vote411.org/.
early_?_3_n:
OK. There are also new options that allow registered voters without photo ID to sign a simple form and present one of the following documents to vote a regular ballot:
Valid voter registration certificate (card)
Certified birth certificate
Current utility bill
Bank statement
Government check
Paycheck
Any other government document with the individual's name and address
